FuncDef:
The cmu-relay command configures the ID and name for the external relay of a CMU. The external relay is used to control an external device.
The undo cmu-relay command deletes the configuration.
By default, no cmu-relay is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of the external relay of a CMU.
The value is 0 or 1.
0: corresponds to RES1+ and RES1? on the panel.1: corresponds to RES2+ and RES2? on the panel.

Specifies the name of the external relay of a CMU.
-

Turns on an external device through an external relay.
-

Turns off an external device through an external relay.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The device provides the environment monitoring function to monitor the environment change. In this case, the maintenance personnel do not need to implement on-site environment monitoring. When detecting the environment change, the device reports an alarm to the NMS. The maintenance personnel can then adjust environment parameters accordingly. This can effectively reduce the maintenance expenditure of the equipment room.
The external relay of a CMU can be configured to automatically control the monitored object. For example, configure the external relay of a CMU to turn on or off the air conditioner when the relay is in the on or off state.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the device equipped with the CMU module.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
